4.instruction:
I gave a friend an instruction and five inputs. The friend read the instruction and wrote an output for every one of the inputs.
Here are the input-output pairs:

Input: Sentence 1: It is not known who created this piece. Sentence 2: She played two beautiful pieces on the piano. Word: piece
Output: not the same

Input: Sentence 1: Receive payment. Sentence 2: Receive a gift. Word: receive
Output: same

Input: Sentence 1: She sat on the edge of the bed. Sentence 2: The water's edge. Word: edge
Output: same

Input: Sentence 1: He watched the house burn. Sentence 2: Maple wood burns well. Word: burn
Output: same

Input: Sentence 1: She didn't touch her food all night. Sentence 2: The two buildings touch. Word: touch
Output: not the same

The instruction was

15.instruction:
I gave a friend an instruction and five inputs. The friend read the instruction and wrote an output for every one of the inputs.
Here are the input-output pairs:

Input: Sentence 1: We hope you never have to suffer the same pain. Sentence 2: Many saints suffered martyrdom. Word: suffer
Output: same

Input: Sentence 1: He was numb with shock. Sentence 2: The old car needed a new set of shocks. Word: shock
Output: not the same

Input: Sentence 1: Ears open to catch every sound. Sentence 2: Catch a glimpse. Word: catch
Output: same

Input: Sentence 1: In the abdominal region. Sentence 2: The temperate regions. Word: region
Output: not the same

Input: Sentence 1: We should meet at a pre-arranged point. Sentence 2: They sailed south around the point. Word: point
Output: not the same

The instruction was
